raw_comment:
In the graph, I notice lots more teens think the world is getting better but, they live in more developed counties that are wealthier and have better tech. The teens also have a more positive outlook on things than the 40+.

I wonder why people think badly about how our world is going and think negatively. Could it be the long hours and days we were in lockdown from covid? The choices our leaders have made? 

I feel like this relates to me and my community because we all look at the world from our perspective and have different opinions than anyone else.

Headline: "The Positive Generation Coming Up"
ace_sentences: I notice that many teens think that the world is getting better.
These teens live in more developed countries.
These countries are wealthier than other countries.
These countries have better technology than other countries.
Teens have a more positive outlook than people who are 40 years old or older.
Some people think badly about how the world is going.
Some people think negatively about the world.
I wonder why these people think negatively.
The covid lockdown lasted for long hours and long days.
The covid lockdown could cause negative thinking.
These choices could cause negative thinking.
This topic relates to my community.
Each person looks at the world from his or her perspective.
The headline is "The Positive Generation Coming Up".
